Package gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.boss

Class Larry

java.lang.Object
gameobjects.GameObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.NonStaticObject
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.Monster
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.SummoningMonster
gameobjects.nonstaticobjects.monsters.boss.Larry
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Larry
extends SummoningMonster
Larry is a Monster that is a Boss. It has the special ability of having a snake like body. This body will go down when Larry's health reaches a certain value.

This class has a lot of variable related to the length, like the ArrayList of Vector2 that stores the ten PreviousPosition of the previous bodyPart. And the integer variable bodyLength that holds Larry's body length at it's creation.

There's also a movingTimer so that Larry can change it's direction randomly.

To check what the other variable from Larry are please refer to Monster, NonStaticObject and GameObject.

See Also:

    • Larry

      public Larry​(Vector2 position, Room room, int bodyLength)
      Constructs a new Laryy whose position is specified by the Vector2 argument and whose room is specified by the Room.
      Parameters:
      position - the position of the new Larry
      room - the room the new Larry will be in
      bodyLength - the length of Larry's body
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - unless the bodylength is greater or equal to 0.

    • updateSummoningGameObject

      public java.util.List<Monster> updateSummoningGameObject()
      Updates Lary's movement as well as Larry's body movement. Also updates the hit and attack cooldown. And Larry's total health gets updated.
      Specified by:
      updateSummoningGameObject in class SummoningMonster
      Returns:
      Larry's half body if it splits in two.

    • updateTenPreviousPosition

      public Vector2[] updateTenPreviousPosition​(Vector2[] tenPreviousPosition, Vector2 newPosition)
      Returns the new Array of Vector2 position where the newPosition is added to the end of list. And every other element is set to the next element.
      Parameters:
      tenPreviousPosition - the previous Array of Vector2 position
      newPosition - the new position that will be added to the Array
      Returns:
      the new Array of Vector2 position.
